item.title: CSV file reading in Ruby
item.author: alberto@albertogrespan.com (Alberto Grespan)
item.description: In the recent days I’ve started using CSV files more and more for data manipulation, specifically for database seeding. CSV is a super easy to use and it doesn’t require a complex text editor… Google Spreadsheets or VIM will work great. This post I will show how to read data from .csv file and dumping it in a Ruby Array of Hashes. It will also show how to seed a Rails database.
